🧜🏼‍♀️Septarian Nodules🖤 each contain calcite, aragonite, chalcedony and even smoky Quartz! 🙌🏼

Also known as Dragonstone 🐉 these are formed during Cretaceous period around 50-70 million years ago! Fossilized and decomposed minerals of sea life which fell to the sea bed formed nodules of mud balls 🌕 when the oceans receded, the mud balls shrank and cracked forming these beautiful pieces which are cut nodules🤩

Use Septarian for protection and spiritual strength 💥 it brings harmony and banished nightmares and negative energy 🖤

Available on live sale 26 March 2PM! ✨

Having trouble sleeping? 😴

It will be hard to find a better crystal to ensure good sleep than Blue Scheelite! Also called Lapis Lace Onyx, this is in fact a mixture of Calcite, Blue Dolomite and a little amount of Scheelite, a calcium tungstate mineral.

This mixture is very rare, and only found one mine in the Kirikkale Province of Turkey 🇹🇷, with mining having been put to a halt indefinitely. 

Find it this Saturday 12 Feb at 2PM at our live sale or buy them in store ☺️

What is the difference between Aragonite and Calcite? 🦋 Aragonite and Calcite are polymorphs - same chemical formula but different crystalline structures. Calcite is the more stable form of Aragonite and in fact Aragonite may turn into Calcite over time with the right pressure and temperature! 💙

Did you know? Many marine creatures have both Aragonite and Calcite in their skeletal structures. These are forms of calcium carbonate 🐚 Aragonite has been found to be more common in organisms and you can find them in Ammonites for example 🌀

Pink or Lavender toned Amethyst - a lot has been in discussion about whether these are really Amethyst or hematite included Quartz! [Available on website] In awe of Mother Nature’s creations! Azurite’s name comes from the word Azure which is used to describe deep blue evening skies above winter or desert landscapes (for those in Singapore: I don’t think anyone here has seen that in a year at least?! 🥺😞) 

So how do these colors form?
Waters that flow into the Earth react with Copper ores, dissolving it and this dissolved Copper flows into another area deep within Earth. Under the new conditions of that environment, and under specific temperature, pressure or water chemistry, the dissolved copper forms Azurite! 🌌 hence you get this River-like appearance in a matrix 💙

📣PSA!📣 Restock happening at 12noon on our Story for these gorgeous high grade natural Chrysocolla spheres from Peru + Crystal Chips butterflies from South Africa 🦋

Take care to check if Chrysocolla you purchase is dyed as there are quite a few Howlite dyed to Blue and Green on the market! There is no straightforward way of determining if the Chrysocolla is dyed but generally having only blue and green colors and no browns is one of the signs of it being dyed. Taking a close look at the Malachite in this piece, you can see the distinctive swirls and bands of Malachite, and the texture of genuine Malachite is very smooth as opposed to 'foamy' or 'airy'. Additionally, take a look at the cracks on the piece. If it is dyed, there will be a build-up of color within the cracks. Lastly, if the crystal is dyed, it will also fade in color or the color will run after wiping with alcohol.

𝔸𝕞𝕞𝕠𝕟𝕚𝕥𝕖 🐚 AVAILABLE These are fossilied Ammonite Molluscs (now extinct) from Tulear, Madagascar and have been preserved for millions of years! they’re completely natural and iridescent. They insides have been cut and polished. Ammonites from Madagascar are from Triassic to Cretaceous age ✨

Many of these specimens have crystalline, sediment or calcified segments. The shells are composed of Aragonite and the iridescence from mother-of-pearl. Madagascan Ammonite is known for its iridescence.

Did you know? The Ammonite is a creature that lived many years ago but today the closest creature to an Ammonite is in fact a squid! 🦑 the Ammonite would trap gas in its many chambers to float in the sea and some are known to have been able to swim. 

Ammonites attract prosperity, wealth & success 💰 due to millions of years of preservation, Ammonites have absorbed a high amount of energy and are used widely for Feng Shui purposes. Additionally, a colourful Ammonite is known to hold more power. It’s coil shape is known to create constant circulation of energy throughout the space 🌀 it’s used to filter out negative energy and the spiral shape reflects the unfolding of life 🐚

Genuine Amber from Indonesia 🕷 also known as “Gold of the Sea” this stone is a biological product of nature. It is formed from resin that is produced in trees in prehistoric forests, and fossilized into these beautiful formations. In some of these pieces you can still see tree bark and if you’re lucky, an insect! (We have yet to find any so far...) 🕷 

Amber holds a strong connection to the sun and earth and all living creatures simply because of its amazing formation. It is a talisman for beauty, protection and renewal. It attuned to ancient wisdom and is known to aid in past life recall and also for purifying the body naturally. 

Did you know that Amber is one of the first export goods from the Baltic region? Amber has defined prehistoric trade routes from Baltic to Mediterranean seas ⚓️

Very honoured to have here at Glace.... some of the most mystical, rare and powerful crystals... Shangaan Amethysts! Shangaan Amethysts are Amethysts with hematite inclusions, scepters and at times, enhydros (last slide). They are ethically mined at Chibuku Mine, Zimbabwe by the tribal Shangaan people using simple surface tools. 

The elders of the Shangaan tribes have asked that these crystals be shared to raise awareness about the communal lands in Zimbabwe and to encourage people to share their perspective on their medicine. 

These crystals form in scepter shapes. This is when a new Quartz Crystal forms over and caps a previously formed crystal. They have a little indentation in the middle although they may not be so clearly “scepter shaped”. This shape serves to bring emotional stimulation and to release trapped anger, fear or resentment. 

Amethyst with hematite inclusions are often called red amethyst. When they work in tandem, it creates a calming and focused rotation of energy in the body. (Sage goddess)

The Shangaan Elestial Amethyst has the ability to help expand the higher mind and also enhances one’s creativity and passion. It strengthens the imagination and intuition, and refines the thinking processes. It helps in the assimilation of new ideas, putting thought into action, and brings projects to fruition. It is a talisman of focus and success for women and girls primarily. (Nharo)

#shangaan #shangaanamethyst #highvibration

One of the modules I took in Uni was Art History (really enjoyed it). I learnt about Arab paintings and I was so intrigued by this pigment called Ultramarine also known as “The Most Perfect Colour” which created the deep blues in many famous paintings, not just Arab paintings. It’s made from Lapis Lazuli stone which is mined in Afghanistan/Pakistan. Here are a couple of famous paintings painted using Ultramarine. “The Girl with the Pearl Earring” by Johannes Vermeer
“View of the Port of Livorno” by Cristoffano Gaffuri
